transcript.text: [Music]
[Music]
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the ex
when he to report my name is Dave and
this is episode 1224 a and today's date
is March 9th 2017 and the thought of the
episode is Trump plants subtle clues in
his office to let the central bankers
know their fate let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now
we're gonna head out to Venezuela and we
can see that over the years the United
States government central bankers a deep
state
they've been meddling in Venezuela they
want Venezuela they want a regime change
they want to take control of their oil
reserves and we see right now that
Venezuela well the whole thing is
completely falling apart their cash
reserves right now are at a catastrophic
low they're around 10 billion in cash
now even though they have the world's
largest oil reserves
Venezuela's economy well they're
struggling just to stay afloat this is
why we see the food dry up on the
shelves long lines at supermarkets
people fighting over meat and we can see
right now that over these next couple of
months
it looks like the Venezuelan government
is going to crash now this is what
United States government central bankers
want they want to get that government
out of power they want to put in a
puppet government they want to take
control of the oil just like in the
Middle East no difference and they were
hoping that this was going to work now
when you look at Venezuela as cash
reserves they have about 10 billion or
so and 7.2 billion of which they must
use this year just to pay off
outstanding debts for instance in 2015
Venezuela had twenty billion dollars in
reserves and in 2011 and had 30 billion
in reserves now it only has ten billion
and 7.2 is going off to pay for debt so
after they pay that off
they really don't have much left and we
can see that time is ticking down and we
should take notice of this because again
the United States government the debt
ceiling is coming up March 15th where
Congress is going to have to make a
decision do we raise the debt ceiling
and put the country into further debt or
you know what we're calling it we're
done we're not raising the debt ceiling
now remember last time the Republicans
didn't want the debt ceiling raised the
Democrats they wanted it pushed up
Boehner and Obama they came up with this
deal that they pushed it off until 2017
once Obama left office so here we are
once again there are many people out
there they're saying that this time
they're not going to do it they're not
going to raise the debt ceiling which
means the United States is going to fall
into the category of what Venezuela is
going through right now where we only
have a certain cash in reserves and that
cash in reserves is going to run out
over time now when we look at this it's
only a couple of months that the United
States can survive so we're gonna have
to watch this situation very closely
because March 15th is going to come yes
the debt ceiling won't be raised on
March 15th but we have to wait to see
over the next coming weeks because if we
enter April if we go past the tax season
of April 15th and we go into May I would
say at that point if the debt ceiling is
not raised that is a warning sign to all
of you to start ramping on them and I
say ramping up I mean getting as much as
you possibly can at that point that
means the collapse is a go that means
that they're not going to raise the debt
ceiling the United States is going to
run out of funds government workers will
be laid
programs will be stopped and this is
when we enter a chaotic period so that
is a warning sign to everyone remember
that tax receipts have been falling
every single year the federal tax
receipts the money coming into the
government the state tax receipts have
also been falling and we're going to see
how much has brought in at this time
because that is the money they're going
to use to pay for things so we're gonna
have to watch this very very carefully
and we'll know in April 15th or April
20th what they're planning on doing we
enter May and nothing is done well that
should tell you you need to start
preparing aggressively because that
means we only have a couple of months
now in the retail market they keep
blaming amazon for what is happening in
the brick-and-mortar stores well it
turns out this is not true at all
now Moody's is out there they're saying
retailers are on the brink of death
they're saying hundreds of department
stores are closing and more are on their
way and we see Brendan Witcher a retail
and e-commerce analyst at research firm
Forrester he completely denies the
notion that Amazon can meaningfully
explain the flux in retail space he says
it's simply not true
it doesn't make any sense when you look
at the actual numbers and Witcher is
referring to the fact that online
shopping still makes up less than a
tenth of the country's total retail
sales despite doubling in the past five
years and this is often cited by the US
Census Bureau it's on the corporate
media and they
that word whoa online sales they have
doubled and this is why the
brick-and-mortar stores can't survive
because everyone's shopping online and
as we can see this figure is really
misleading on its face because it's
overly broad for most purposes for one
it includes gas stations on the retail
side which obviously don't have any
online equivalent it also lumps together
everything from groceries to auto parts
and furniture among which the ratio of
online to offline sales varies greatly
and we can see that the real world
industry is headed towards a bloodbath
and actually when we listen to the CEO
of Urban Outfitters he is saying that
the retail bubble has now burst just
like housing and what he's talking about
is the number of empty commercial real
estate Lots in the US it is gigantic he
says and it looks like at this point
that that is the next bubble that is
going to pop right now now the bankers
are not going to be very happy with
Trump because it looks like Trump he did
promise to restore glass-steagall and it
looks like coming from Sean Spicer he
says that Trump is still committed to
restoring glass-steagall and as soon as
this was mentioned the stock market went
down a little bit because the banks they
don't want glass-steagall they like
making these speculative investments and
this is what led up to the 2008 crash
this was the start of it now something
very interesting in Trump's office he's
leaving subtle clues on what he's going
to do with the central bank and right
now we know it's no secret that America
is really governed by the US Federal
Reserve System and the Federal Reserve
well they're in charge of the money
supply and it's not part of the
government it's separate and apart
it's a private corporation and we see
back in April of 2016 the Treasury
secretary back then Jacob Lew announced
that the country was gonna change the
five to ten and twenty dollar bill and
have a new design and then they came out
with saying that well the people are
demanding that we change who is on the
bills when he says we're just following
the voice of the people now of course
they never let us know how they came up
with this of course they were making
this up their whole plan was to remove
Andrew Jackson from the $20 bill and
replace Andrew Jackson with Harriet
Tubman now everyone was like well he was
a slave owner he was this and he was
that well you have to remember the time
going back to that time period and that
was the norm back then and if we start
removing all these individuals from
history we wouldn't have any history not
just in the United States but around the
world yes times change but the real
reason why they didn't want Andrew
Jackson on the 20 is because he got rid
of the central bank the second Bank in
the United States now he ran on a
campaign slogan where he said no Bank
and Jackson or Bank and no Jackson and
Trump did something very very
interesting when he moved into the White
House he put up a portrait of Andrew
Jackson it's right behind him in his
office what does that tell you that
tells you that he's sending a message to
the central bankers and we see right now
one of the things that Andrew Jackson
said and this really sums it up
controlling our currency receiving our
public monies and holding thousands of
our citizens independence it would be
more formidable
dangerous than then the navel and the
military power of the enemy and what
he's saying is that a central bank that
is not part of the US government not
working for the people is more dangerous
than the military power of an enemy and
we can see that today and just by Trump
putting up Andrew Jackson's portrait it
sends a message to the central bank
saying listen we're coming for you we're
going to get rid of you and this really
should show everyone where we are headed
because the fate of the central bank it
looks like they are doomed and it looks
like it's time to remove the central
bank now when Andrew Jackson tried to
remove the central bank and not he
actually vetoed the bill that Congress
passed to extend the life of the second
bank of the United States he vetoed it
and of course they tried to assassinate
him because this is what central bankers
do they've they tried more than once but
they couldn't get to him
now again Trump right now is going up
against the deep state he's sending a
message to the central bankers and we're
gonna see how far he's going to take
this we're gonna look at his actions and
see what he does that doesn't mean the
central bank the deep states not going
to react of course they're going to
react they're not just gonna lay down
and say hey no big deal
we don't need it now he doesn't really
need Congress to do anything with the
central bank he can just basically say
we're done with it so just by putting
that up in his office he's actually
broadcasting what he's going to do so
what we're looking at right now is this
battle between the central bank the deep
state and the Trump administration
where this will go what will happen well
we don't know at this point but what we
do know is that one way or another
the economy is not going to survive and
we know that Trump has been promising
these manufacturing jobs promising these
jobs to be brought back into the US and
the way the economy sits right now it
makes no sense so we know that the
central bank is preparing to bring down
the economy and point the finger
someplace else because they're gonna be
raising the rates into a weak economy
this was done back in 1937 the whole
thing just came down does it mean if
they raise rates it's gonna come down in
a split second no it means they're
slowly doing it 25 basis points here
another 25 basis but we know from past
reports we said once the central bank
starts raising the rates we know we have
a certain time period we know the debt
ceiling like I mentioned earlier is
coming up so when we put all these
pieces together it gives us some type of
signal then the other signal is when we
see gold and silver start to shoot up we
start to put the picture together you
start to understand what it's going
these are all the warning signs to let
you know what is happening so we the
next couple of months very critical as
we approach the debt ceiling and as we
move past the debt ceiling we need to
watch this very carefully listen
everyone thanks a lot for listening be
well be safe and especially be prepared
thanks a lot
